Name: Mummy
Description: The mummified remains of a fish, probably 'Lates Niloticus'.The fish was sacred in some regions of ancient Egypt but not in others. The Delta city of Mendes was the cult centre for the goddess Hatmehit who was worshipped in the form of a fish or that of a woman wearing a fish emblem on her head. Tomb paintings are rich in their depictions of river scenes, the Nile teeming with aquatic life.
